events.message: Applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses related to an unexpected surgery last month.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under Personal Loan based on the applicant's description of medical debt coverage.
Loan officer Maria Hernandez was assigned to oversee the applicant’s medical personal loan application and provide assistance.
Initial review completed to verify applicant’s stated income, employment, and reasons for a personal loan due to medical bills.
Applicant was asked to submit medical bills, proof of surgery, recent pay stubs, and identification documents for verification.
Applicant submitted all requested documents including medical receipts, employer pay slips, and government-issued ID promptly.
Credit bureau report retrieved showing good standing with minor past credit card balances currently paid off.
Risk assessment indicated moderate risk based on medical-related loan purpose but stable income and credit history.
A personal loan offer with favorable interest rate and flexible repayment terms was presented to the applicant for review.
Applicant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the loan offer terms and requesting minor clarification on repayment schedule.
Application was escalated to senior management for further approval due to requested adjustments in loan repayment terms.
Senior management approved the personal loan application including requested repayment schedule amendments as agreed.
Funds for the approved personal loan were successfully transferred to the applicant’s bank account to cover medical expenses.
Follow-up call made with the applicant to ensure receipt of funds and to answer any questions about repayment process.
The personal loan application case was formally closed after confirmation that all initial requirements were met satisfactorily.
